div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 84 "Tripolitsa" (Tripolis), Arcadia, 1921 (1131) Burial: c. 315-310 B.C. Contents: 23 AR Philip II: 6 tetradr. (Amphipolis) Alexander III: 14 lifetime or early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 4, unc. Macedon 1, Miletus 1, Side 3, Myriandrus 1, Damascus 1, Babylon 3) Aegina: 3 st. (tortoise) Disposition: New York 5 (coins illus. by Newell plus a second Philip) Newell, NNM 21 (1923), pp. 32-6, illus. Possibly part of Andritsaena hd., no. 83 above
